Sr. Systems Support Analyst

  At Bank of Montreal, we believe in our people, and we provide them with a positive environment in which they can reach their full potential. As one of North America's premier financial institutions, with more than 30 lines of business within our group of companies, we are always looking for new and exciting ways to serve our clients. It is a dynamic work environment that makes good business sense.


These are the six main areas of the role:


System/Network Maintenance & Resource Management

Coordinate and direct the work of assigned analysts

Installation & configuration of system hardware & software, third party software

Perform upgrades & testing for system/network hardware and software, firewall and third party tools

Analyze and resolve complex performance user/system problems and outages to software and firewall products

Monitor & fix/patch operating system and tools vulnerabilities

Compilation, packaging, installation & debug of security shareware software

System security administration, hardening and auditing

System and security tools performance tuning

System resources monitoring, tuning and planning for production needs

Network naming services configuration and administration

Network and firewall hardware installation and configuration

Scripting of automation tools for system maintenance/monitoring activities

Research & evaluation of third party software according to production needs

Follow change management procedures to implement changes in production

Documentation of security, system maintenance procedures and system/security tools usages


Production Support

Provide on-call support for daily firewalls and Unix systems

Report and coordinate resolution of production problems to Production Support Managers

Provide implementation support to users and development/application support teams


Communication/Reporting

Provide weekly status to Production Support Managers

Attend individual and group meetings as required by management

Strong vendor relationship management and troubleshooting experience


Teamwork

Able to contribute to group activities and objectives

High professionalism

Able to communicate effectively with peers and managers

Provide effective assistance to group members in problem resolution


Required:

University degree in either Computer Science, or a related engineering discipline (electrical/electronic engineering, etc.)

Minimum 3+ years experience of Unix operating system administration in Solaris including system security e.g. SSH, LDAP, CA.

Minimum 2+ years experience in firewall administration using one of CheckPoint, Cisco PIX and Netscreen

Strong knowledge of firewall technologies and principles (e.g. NAT)

Strong knowledge and solid working experience of Solaris 8 and CheckPoint-NG and one of Cisco PIX or Netscreen firewalls

Strong knowledge of networking protocols (TCP/IP, PKI, NIS, DNS, HTTP, NFS, DHCP, various Microsoft network protocols, etc)

Working experience of Cisco IOS and Apache/Netscape web servers an asset

Working experience of Unix shell scripting (ksh, sh, perl)

Solid analytical skills for problem solving

Good communication and project coordination skills

Able to work under pressure

Minimal travel may be required


Desired:

Working experience of Cisco switch and routers

Working experience of VPN technologies e.g IPsec

CCNA and/or Checkpoint certification

Experience with market data feeds e.g. Reuters, Telerate, Bloomberg etc an asset

Knowledge of web related development languages/tools, e.g. Java, JavaScript, Servlets, CGI programming

Windows NT/2000 system administration and security hardening


Bank of Montreal thanks all applicants. We advise that only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted.


We are committed to an equitable workplace and a diverse workforce.


Additional Information
Position Type: Full Time, Permanent
Ref Code: DSBAK00644  

Contact Information
BMO Financial Group - BMO Groupe Financier
